newsitem.title: USA: Laser Vision Centers to add 60 sites.
newsitem.headline: Laser Vision Centers to add 60 sites.

text.p: Laser Vision Centers Inc said Friday it expects to open about 60 laser sites in the U.S. this year driven, in part, by regulatory approval of expanded use of the lasers to improve vision.

"This new approval should bolster our U.S. expansion because surgeons want access to lasers that can treat astigmatism," said Laser Vision Chairman and Chief Executive Officer John Klobnak, in a statement.

Earlier today, California-based VISX Corp said the U.S. Food and Drug Administration approved the use of VISX's excimer laser systems for treatment of low to moderate nearsightedness with astigmatism. Previously, the lasers were approved to correct nearsightedness only.
Laser Vision said that more than 80 percent of its excimer laser fleet is comprised of VISX lasers which are currently capable of treating astigmatism with no hardware modification.
Astigmatism, characterized by blurred and distorted vision, occurs when the cornea is unable to clearly focus images on the retina.

VISX's system is an automated, computer-controlled procedure that uses a cool beam of laser light to reshape the front surface of the cornea. The outpatient procedure usually lasts less than one minute.
Laser Vision currently operates over 50 excimer lasers sites with locations in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, Ireland, Sweden, Finland and Greece.
Shares of Laser Vision were trading off 1/4 to 6-1/4. Shares of VISX added 1-3/4 to 22-1/2.
